content.description: Follow 5 bolts in the dihedral just left of Ready!.  The 1st bolt is a bit high but well placed since the climbing is mellow up to that point.  The crux is going through the diheral and it's over once you hit the ramp that goes up and left.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.

content.description: This has good climbing past 4 bolts.  I think the crux comes high, which is good, because the bolting is a bit sporty in a few spots.  Head up the narrow dihedral and then just left of the black streak.
content.protection: 4 (5?) bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains. It is possible to TR this route from scrambling around the side.

content.description: This is the [second] furthest route to the climber's right.  Follow 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.  I put this at 5.9 because that's what the FA rated it, but I felt like it is more like 9+.  I don't think there is a move harder than 9, but it's pretty consistent 9 moves, and it's difficult to get off your hands.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.

climbs.name: Finish Line
climbs.fa: Steve Buchanan, BJ Sbarra and Lynn Sanson

content.description:
Furthest route right on Junior Olympic Wall.  Good climbing on vertical rock, thoughtful moves to a bulge, then an easy last 10 feet.

This is Steve B's first FA, nice work.
content.location: Furthest route right on J.O. Wall.  Start in broken rock just left of a large tree.  The first moves feel steeper than they appear, fun movement takes you to a slight bulge near the top.  Pop over the bulge and easy moves to the anchor.
